maml:description.maml:para: Generates a new root key for the Microsoft Group KdsSvc within Active Directory.

The Add-KdsRootKey cmdlet generates a new root key for the Microsoft Group Key Distribution Service (KdsSvc) within Active Directory. The Microsoft Group KdsSvc generates new group keys from the new root key.
Specifies the date on which the newly generated root key takes effect. If this parameter is not specified, the default date set is 10 days after the current date.
Indicates that the new root key is generated on the local host only. This parameter is used with the Set-KdsConfiguration cmdlet to test the local server configuration.
If this parameter is specified, then the cmdlet returns a value that indicates whether the test passed.
If this parameter is not specified, then the cmdlet returns the identifier (ID) of the root key when the operation succeeds.
Prompts you for confirmation before running the cmdlet.Prompts you for confirmation before running the cmdlet.
Shows what would happen if the cmdlet runs. The cmdlet is not run.Shows what would happen if the cmdlet runs. The cmdlet is not run.
Indicates that the new root key is generated on the local host only. This parameter is used with the Set-KdsConfiguration cmdlet to test the local server configuration.
If this parameter is specified, then the cmdlet returns a value that indicates whether the test passed.
If this parameter is not specified, then the cmdlet returns the identifier (ID) of the root key when the operation succeeds.
Indicates that the Microsoft Group Key Distribution Service immediately uses the new root key.
Prompts you for confirmation before running the cmdlet.Prompts you for confirmation before running the cmdlet.
Shows what would happen if the cmdlet runs. The cmdlet is not run.Shows what would happen if the cmdlet runs. The cmdlet is not run.
Indicates that the Microsoft Group Key Distribution Service immediately uses the new root key.
Specifies the date on which the newly generated root key takes effect. If this parameter is not specified, the default date set is 10 days after the current date.
Indicates that the new root key is generated on the local host only. This parameter is used with the Set-KdsConfiguration cmdlet to test the local server configuration.
If this parameter is specified, then the cmdlet returns a value that indicates whether the test passed.
If this parameter is not specified, then the cmdlet returns the identifier (ID) of the root key when the operation succeeds.
Prompts you for confirmation before running the cmdlet.Prompts you for confirmation before running the cmdlet.
Shows what would happen if the cmdlet runs. The cmdlet is not run.Shows what would happen if the cmdlet runs. The cmdlet is not run.
This cmdlet accepts no input objects.

command:example.maml:title: Example 1: Generate a new root key

dev:remarks.maml:para: This command generates a new root key for the Microsoft Group KdsSvc within Active Directory.

command:example.maml:title: Example 2: Generate a new root key for immediate use

dev:remarks.maml:para: This command generates a new root key immediately and adds it to the Microsoft Group KdsSvc.

command:example.maml:title: Example 3: Generate a new root key which takes effect on a specific date

dev:remarks.maml:para: This command generates a new root key for the Microsoft Group KdsSvc which takes effect on the date 03/06/2013. Use the mm/dd/yyyy format.

command:example.maml:title: Example 4: Generate a new root key on the local host only

dev:remarks.maml:para: This command generates a new root key on the local host only.

maml:description.maml:para: Clears the group key cache of the local computer.
The Clear-KdsCache cmdlet clears the group key cache of the local computer.
The local computer can be either a domain controller running the Microsoft Group Key Distribution Service (KdsSvc) or a client of the Microsoft Group KdsSvc.
Specifies the security identifier (SID) for the user account whose cache this cmdlet clears.
Prompts you for confirmation before running the cmdlet.Prompts you for confirmation before running the cmdlet.
Shows what would happen if the cmdlet runs. The cmdlet is not run.Shows what would happen if the cmdlet runs. The cmdlet is not run.
Specifies the security identifier (SID) for the user account whose cache this cmdlet clears.
Prompts you for confirmation before running the cmdlet.Prompts you for confirmation before running the cmdlet.
Shows what would happen if the cmdlet runs. The cmdlet is not run.Shows what would happen if the cmdlet runs. The cmdlet is not run.
This cmdlet accepts no input objects.
This cmdlet produces no output.

command:example.maml:title: Example 1: Clear the group key cache

dev:remarks.maml:para: This command clears the group key cache of the local computer.

command:example.maml:title: Example 2: Clear the group key cache of a specific user

dev:remarks.maml:para: This command clears the group key cache of the user with SID s-1-1-0.

maml:description.maml:para: Retrieves the current configuration of the Microsoft Group KdsSvc from Active Directory.

The Get-KdsConfiguration cmdlet retrieves the current configuration of the Microsoft Group Key Distribution Service (KdsSvc) from Active Directory. The KDS configuration defines how keys are generated from the root keys.
This cmdlet accepts no input objects.
This cmdlet returns a KdsServerConfiguration object contains information such as the key derivation function (KDF) algorithm and secret agreement algorithm used in key generation.

command:example.maml:title: Example 1: Retrieve the current KDS configuration

dev:remarks.maml:para: This command retrieves the current configuration of the Microsoft Group KdsSvc from Active Directory.

maml:description.maml:para: Retrieves a list of root key values stored by the Microsoft Group KdsSvc.

The Get-KdsRootKey cmdlet retrieves the following information from Active Directory for each root key:
-- The root key identifier -- The root key value -- The Microsoft Group Key Distribution Service (KdsSvc)
This information is required to generate the group keys distributed by the Microsoft Group KdsSvc.
This cmdlet accepts no input objects.
This cmdlet returns a list of master root keys stored in Active Directory.

command:example.maml:title: Example 1: Retrieve a list of root key values

dev:remarks.maml:para: This command retrieves a list of root key values stored in Active Directory.

maml:description.maml:para: Sets the configuration of Microsoft Group KdsSvc.

The Set-KdsConfiguration cmdlet sets the configuration of Microsoft Group Key Distribution Service (KdsSvc). This cmdlet sets the following configuration data:
-- The key derivation function algorithm and parameters used to generate private group keys -- The secret agreement algorithm and parameters used to generate public group keys
This cmdlet also validates input by performing key derivation function tests and secret agreement tests.
Specifies the server configuration object that contains the configuration information of the Microsoft Group KdsSvc.
Indicates that the cmdlet only validates the new group key distribution service configuration on the local computer, and does not store the key in Active Directory.
If this parameter is specified, then the cmdlet returns a value that indicates whether the test passed.
If this parameter is not specified, then the cmdlet returns the new server configuration object.
Prompts you for confirmation before running the cmdlet.Prompts you for confirmation before running the cmdlet.
Shows what would happen if the cmdlet runs. The cmdlet is not run.Shows what would happen if the cmdlet runs. The cmdlet is not run.
Specifies the name of the key derivation function algorithm that the key distribution server uses to generate the keys.

Specifies the parameters for the key derivation function used to generate the group private key. If this parameter is not specified or this parameter is set to $Null, then no key derivation function parameters are needed.
Indicates that the cmdlet only validates the new group key distribution service configuration on the local computer, and does not store the key in Active Directory.
If this parameter is specified, then the cmdlet returns a value that indicates whether the test passed.
If this parameter is not specified, then the cmdlet returns the new server configuration object.
Specifies the name of the secret agreement algorithm used to generate a group public key.
Specifies the parameters for the secret agreement algorithm. If this parameter is not specified or this parameter is set to $Null, then no secret agreement algorithm parameters are needed.
Specifies the length of the private key used in the secret agreement algorithm.
Specifies the length of the public key used in the secret agreement algorithm.
Prompts you for confirmation before running the cmdlet.Prompts you for confirmation before running the cmdlet.
Shows what would happen if the cmdlet runs. The cmdlet is not run.Shows what would happen if the cmdlet runs. The cmdlet is not run.
Indicates that the cmdlet only validates the new group key distribution service configuration on the local computer, and does not store the key in Active Directory.
If this parameter is specified, then the cmdlet returns a value that indicates whether the test passed.
If this parameter is not specified, then the cmdlet returns the new server configuration object.
Indicates that the customized service configuration is reverted to the default configuration.
Prompts you for confirmation before running the cmdlet.Prompts you for confirmation before running the cmdlet.

Specifies the server configuration object that contains the configuration information of the Microsoft Group KdsSvc.
Specifies the name of the key derivation function algorithm that the key distribution server uses to generate the keys.

Specifies the parameters for the key derivation function used to generate the group private key. If this parameter is not specified or this parameter is set to $Null, then no key derivation function parameters are needed.
Indicates that the cmdlet only validates the new group key distribution service configuration on the local computer, and does not store the key in Active Directory.
If this parameter is specified, then the cmdlet returns a value that indicates whether the test passed.
If this parameter is not specified, then the cmdlet returns the new server configuration object.
Indicates that the customized service configuration is reverted to the default configuration.
Specifies the name of the secret agreement algorithm used to generate a group public key.
Specifies the parameters for the secret agreement algorithm. If this parameter is not specified or this parameter is set to $Null, then no secret agreement algorithm parameters are needed.
Specifies the length of the private key used in the secret agreement algorithm.
Specifies the length of the public key used in the secret agreement algorithm.
Prompts you for confirmation before running the cmdlet.Prompts you for confirmation before running the cmdlet.
Shows what would happen if the cmdlet runs. The cmdlet is not run.Shows what would happen if the cmdlet runs. The cmdlet is not run.
This cmdlet returns a KdsServerConfiguration object that contains configuration information for the Microsoft Group KdsSvc.

command:example.maml:title: Example 1: Set the configuration of Microsoft Group Key Distribution Service
command:example.dev:code: PS C:\> $config = Get-KdsConfiguration PS C:\> Set-KdsConfiguration –InputObject $config

dev:remarks.maml:para: This command retrieves a server configuration object in to a variable $config using the Get-KdsConfiguration cmdlet, and passes the contents of the variable to this cmdlet.

command:example.maml:title: Example 2: Test the configuration on the local server

dev:remarks.maml:para: This command tests the local server configuration.

command:example.maml:title: Example 3: Set the key derivation function algorithm

dev:remarks.maml:para: This command sets the key derivation function (KDF) algorithm name to SHA-1. This algorithm generates a private group key.

command:example.maml:title: Example 4: Set the secret agreement algorithm

dev:remarks.maml:para: This command sets the secret agreement algorithm name to ECDH. This algorithm generates a public group key.

command:example.maml:title: Example 5: Set the Group Key Distribution Service configuration to the default configuration

dev:remarks.maml:para: This command validates that the customized group key distribution service configurations are deleted and the SID key starts to use the default configuration.

maml:description.maml:para: Tests the root key configuration.
The Test-KdsRootKey cmdlet tests that the root key with the specified key identifier (ID) uses a valid configuration. The test verifies generation of both new group public key and group private key.
This cmdlet is useful for analyzing failures based on invalid root key configuration failures.
Specifies the ID of the root key to test.
Prompts you for confirmation before running the cmdlet.Prompts you for confirmation before running the cmdlet.
Shows what would happen if the cmdlet runs. The cmdlet is not run.Shows what would happen if the cmdlet runs. The cmdlet is not run.
Specifies the ID of the root key to test.
Prompts you for confirmation before running the cmdlet.Prompts you for confirmation before running the cmdlet.
Shows what would happen if the cmdlet runs. The cmdlet is not run.Shows what would happen if the cmdlet runs. The cmdlet is not run.
This cmdlet accepts no input objects.
This cmdlet returns whether the root key can be used to generate derived keys.

command:example.maml:title: Example 1: Test the root key configuration

dev:remarks.maml:para: This command tests the configuration of the root key specified by key ID.
